intro: Microlicia australis, commonly known as the Australian microlicia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Microlicia australis is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with low rainfall.
